intro: Trichotosia phaeotricha, commonly known as the black-haired trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Trichotosia phaeotricha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
